item.title: Notes on: Resilient Life: An Exploration of Perturbed Autopoietic Patterns in Conway's Game of Life by Cika, A., Cohen, E., Kruszewski, G., Seet, L., Steinmann, P., & Yin, W. (2020)
item.description: tags ALife 2020, Cellular automata, Autopoiesis source (Cika et al. 2020) Summary This paper is about the possible resistance of GoL patterns to perturbations and the structures that could enable this to happen. They also want to know if resilience is a universal property of computational systems. They test two types of resilience: Additive (add one or two live cells to the pattern) Negative (“kill” one or two live cells from the pattern) They use 3 metrics for resilience:
